title: @Riot When are you going to stop being so forgiving of adcs?
body:
This has happened SO MANY TIMES. 
ADC abuses x and gets away with it.
Oh mage is using this or assassin abusing this? Insta nerf. Oh but wait, there are so few instances that they DO that, but you better believe when it happens it gets insta nerfed.
Varus mid has been a thing. Funny how the minute varus got bursted by syndra, a mage in her own territory, she gets insta nerfed. Prime example of riot favoriting adcs. I am not denying syndra didn't need to be tweaked but it isn't a coincidence that the minute adc mains complained about burst mages they get toned down.
"OMFG QQ LEBLANC HURTS SO MUCH"  So they turned her into a kite mage. Meanwhile draven still throws one axe and deletes everything in sight.
Funny how adcs will cry about getting deleted meanwhile {{champion:29}}  exists and will delete an entire team. He's been, what, number 1-5 adc for a while.
"ADCs are meant to be squishy" but yet tanks are about to get punished for adcs abusing d shield? Sounds about right.
Now Lucian has been mid a handful of times in pro play but now its getting more and more popular. And there is NOTHING fun or rewarding about winning against him. I was playing Taliyah, if I missed w, he auto killed me. He had essence reaver and zeal when I had roa and rylais and he still deleted me. Like what is the counterplay? Oh wait there isn't any because riot doesn't give a shit about mages, contrary to popular belief riot hasent cared about what happens mid lane for a LONG time, that is of course unless it is interfering with bot lane or jungle or even top.

ADC are flashy and simple to use and the majority of players are simple-minded and like flashy things.
Hmm, and i guess your picks are the only ones who require skill to play?

Why is it ok for ADC to go mid and beat anyone in lane when they do all the damage to towers and all the damage in teamfights?  An adc  that goes mid should get crushed off of base stats alone. But Lucian gets to statcheck everyone from Orianna to Zed at all stages of the game.

Because most Mages that go mid aren't point and click mages. They're skillshot oriented and Lucian is a really mobile Marksman. Or are you asking me why is it fair for Lucian to specifically go mid?

I mean, you can make the same argument with Galio mid that builds tank and still manages waves no problem, deals a lot of damage to champions if he catches them, can soak up a lot of punishment and can still be at one ult reach from either top or bot lane, thanks to his ult (and he has a TP as well). So in respect to Lucian mid, why is Galio allowed to perform in the role of a mid laner that is usually a Mages job, as a tank?

Furthermore, didn't Riot change the damage for mages to scale off their AP (to true damage dealt to turrets on AAs) quite a while ago? So AD and AP champions should scale similarly when it comes to AA damage to turrets from their respective stats and the only difference should be in AS and crit Marksmen always buy. But Lucian mid doesn't buy crit, as far as i've seen.

I highly doubt Lucian mid wins against an assassin like Zed.
If he does, it's because of Exhaust to at least allow him to not die to Zed's burst while he duels him for his life. And that will most likely happen the moment he buys BotrK, not before. He does need some lifesteal after all.

The point was, adcs shouldn't get to do what they want for free. Solo lane lulu got gutted like 50 times because she needed to be a support, solo lane janna too. Not to mention it's the fact that it's bullshit that you play a skill shot oriented champion into someone who just autos you to death. Real fair counterplay there right? 
Also, Galio isn't a tank fully, he still scales off of ap pretty well and has always been designated for the mid lane, kind of like Vladimir, or Swain

Lucian was nerfed time and time again.
Lethality, BC, BorK... You name it. Riot can't just destroy a champion because some people don't like them going mid (Lucian mid). If he is healthy there, i don't see a reason why Riot should force him to go bot again. People did the exact opposite for Ziggs bot, where THEY wanted Riot to do nothing to Ziggs because they found that a mage replacing a Marksman was a nice change of pace.

Riot replied that if the style was healthy and could be supported by the current bot lane meta, they didn't intend to meddle in those matters. If the entire bot lane shifted because of Ziggs (or mid lane shifts because of Lucian), both of them would've been nerfed. Not saying that Lucian can't be nerfed if he's too strong, i'm just saying that there's a reason why Riot takes action sometimes immediately and why other times they don't.

Janna is the worst example you could've provided as she was meant to be a support, nothing else. If she builds AP, her utility is immensely boosted. She herself doesn't have any reliable damage but she has a ton of healing, damage absorption and CC. The way her kit works basically supports non-aggression and the reason why her "mage" was gutted (solo laner) was because she didn't even fight her opponent, she just cleared minion waves with a single use of her Q. No enemy champion could pressure her lane and if they managed to do so, shielding turrets was again delaying it considerably.

Remember that Sivir was reworked for the same reason, because she didn't even fight in her lane, she was just eating up entire minion waves with the use of her Richochet constantly.

What part of Doran's Shield is being "abused" by Marksmen?
The item is simply too good for a starting item and it provides a hefty ton of HP regen so not even Marksmen want to avoid it, at the expense of some early game damage. If you can take damage and not waste pots in excess (regen a lot of it back over time), than the item's a bit too strong.

Same thing happened with Frost Queen's Claim, after it got buffed for Supports. Mages ended up buying it as a first item to dip into gold gen not meant for them and as a cheep active slow that could pretty much secure ganks and make sure the enemy wasn't going anywhere if you intended to blow them up with, at that point, undodgeable skillshots. So that time, Mages weren't "broken as shit" because of this, FQC was simply too good to pass up for a class that could've used it due to it's stats. I didn't see Tanks or Junglers dip into the same item, because the gold gen was not worth the stats you're paying for and not using for anything.
